title: Healy’s heroics power Australia to record-breaking chase against India
byline: Defending champions Australia chased down a mammoth 331 to beat India by three wickets with an over to spare in a pulsating Women’s World Cup clash in Visakhapatnam on Sunday.

title: Jaswar Umar Appointed to FIFA Grassroots Committee
byline: Worldgoverning body FIFA has appointed Football Federation of Sri Lanka (FFSL) President Jaswar Umar to its prestigious Committee for Grassroots and Amateur Football.

title: Surge in online scams reported in Sri Lanka
byline: The Sri Lanka Computer Emergency Response Team (SLCERT) has raised an alarm over a surge in online scams targeting unsuspecting victims.

title: Harini to meet Chinese President Xi today, PM Li tomorrow
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya who is on a visit to China will hold a bilateral meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping today and with her counterpart Li Qiang tomorrow.

title: Majority of hospitalizations in Sri Lanka due to accidents: Minister
byline: The majority of hospitalizations in Sri Lanka are caused by accidents, many of which are preventable, Health and Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Cop in trouble for expressing his love
byline: A Police Sergeant while behaving in an unruly manner under the influence of liquor and kissed and embraced an underage girl at the Bibila bus stand was taken into custody by Bibila police and produced before Bibila Magistrate Thyaga Silva.

title: Motorist gets judge’s sympathy
byline: A motorist who allegedly blocked a High Court judge’s vehicle, used obscene language, and threatened him was released after the judge personally intervened, police said.

title: Police to charge fees for security at commercial events
byline: Inspector General of Police Priyantha Weerasuriya has decided to charge fees for providing police security at events held for commercial purposes, such as concerts, while continuing to provide security for free at non-commercial events.

title: Mahinda, Maithripala asks bullet proof vehicles back
byline: The Ministry of Public Security is reviewing requests by former Presidents Mahinda Rajapaksa and Maithripala Sirisena to return bulletproof vehicles previously allocated to them, Minister Ananda Wijepala told the Daily Mirror.

title: Sri Lanka faces tougher conditions in retaining GSP+
byline: A great deal of work remains to be done by Sri Lanka to retain and expand its export market in the European Union (EU), which currently absorbs more than 24 percent of the country’s total exports, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Sri Lanka chairs WHO South-East Asia Regional Committee session
byline: The 78th session of the World Health Organization’s (WHO) Regional Committee for South-East Asia commenced in Colombo today (13), with Sri Lanka’s Health Minister, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, elected as Chairman for a one-year term.

title: Man killed in toilet pit explosion in Pilana
byline: A 56-year-old man was killed following an explosion in a toilet pit at his residence in Pilana, Nagashandiya, within the Habaraduwa Police Division.

title: Government online services disrupted due to Lanka Government Cloud outage
byline: Several online public services operated by government institutions have been temporarily disrupted following a technical issue affecting the Lanka Government Cloud (LGC).

title: First seven Israeli hostages released by Hamas in Gaza
byline: Israel has received the first seven captives released by Hamas and handed over to the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) in Gaza.

title: Trump says ‘don’t worry about China’ after Beijing responds to 100% tariff threat
byline: President Trump moved to ease tensions with China on Sunday after threatening to impose a sweeping 100% tariff on all its imports in retaliation for Beijing’s new export controls.

title: Mount Lavinia court incident: Constable granted bail
byline: The police officer charged in connection with assaulting an attorney-at-law within the Mount Lavinia Court premises was released on bail today.

title: Red Cross begins operation to receive first Israeli hostages in Gaza
byline: The Red Cross said on Monday it had begun an operation in the Gaza Strip to pick up the first of 20 surviving Israeli hostages from militant group Hamas, the initial phase of a ceasefire agreement aimed at ending the conflict in Gaza that U.S. President Donald Trump helped to broker

title: Sri Lankan among three arrested at Bengaluru airport with drugs
byline: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Oct 9 seized 45.4kg of hydro ganja and 6kg of psilocybin mushrooms at Kempegowda International Airport (KIA). Three persons, including a Sri Lankan, were arrested.

title: One in four Sri Lankan teens likely to suffer from depression
byline: A new study has revealed that a large number of Sri Lankan adolescents are facing serious mental health challenges, with one in four showing clinically significant symptoms of depression and more than half reporting high levels of psychological distress.

title: Harsha de Silva defends Suwa Seriya brand
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya MP Harsha de Silva clarified that despite government claims, the Suwa Seriya ambulance service is not his personal property.

title: Mahinda, Maithripala ask bullet proof vehicles back
byline: The Ministry of Public Security is reviewing requests by former Presidents Mahinda Rajapaksa and Maithripala Sirisena to return bulletproof vehicles previously allocated to them, Minister Ananda Wijepala told the Daily Mirror.

title: FR petition filed against heavy mineral sand mining project in Mannar
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition has been filed in the Supreme Court challenging the proposed heavy mineral sand extraction project on Mannar Island.

title: Mount Lavinia HQI transferred
byline: Mount Lavinia Police Headquarters Inspector (HQI) H.T.M. Thushara has been transferred with immediate effect, Police said.

title: England Women’s Cricket Team bats for girls’ empowerment in SL
byline: The  England Women’s Cricket Team joined over 40 girls representing 12 districts for a training session at the Singhalese Sports Club ground, according to a statement from the British High Commission.

title: Hamas hands over all remaining hostages to Israel, Trump says Gaza war over
byline: Hamas handed over all 20 surviving hostages to Israel on Monday, a major step towards ending two years of devastating war in Gaza as U.S. President Donald Trump, who helped broker the truce, proclaimed it was ’’a great day’’.

title: Ex-President records statement before Bribery Commission
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption this morning (13).

title: Public cheers as Police constable granted bail
byline: The Police Constable, remanded for allegedly assaulting a lawyer at the Mount Lavinia court premises, was greeted with cheers after being granted bail today.
